keyword: how many calories are in a slice of cheese pizza
title: How Many Calories in a Slice of Cheese Pizza?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a slice of cheese pizza—about 285 kcal—plus full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for your pie.
h1: How Many Calories in a Slice of Cheese Pizza?
assumptions: Standard 14-inch pizza, one slice (1/8 of whole), thin crust, tomato sauce, mozzarella cheese; baked, no extra toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, crust thickness, cheese amount, sauce type, and baking method. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of cheese pizza contains about 285 calories, with 12 g protein and 36 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use thin crust instead of regular

faqs.q: How many calories are in a slice of cheese pizza?
faqs.a: Approximately 285 kcal for a standard slice.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one slice of cheese pizza?
faqs.a: About 12 g of protein per slice.

faqs.q: Does cheese pizza have a lot of sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 640 mg per slice from cheese and sauce.

faqs.q: How do carbs break down in cheese pizza?
faqs.a: Mostly from the crust: 36 g total carbs, 2 g fiber, 4 g sugars per slice.

faqs.q: What affects calories in cheese pizza slices?
faqs.a: Crust type, cheese quantity, slice size, and added oils or toppings vary the count.
